channel.title: Windows boot program
channel.description: Something happened and a weird boot menu was installed on my pc, when i turn it on, a blue window pops up with a list of all the possible os's, i think its in the bios because it shows up before windows boots, and i accidentally hit an f# key that made it stop showing up, but its still there. it said the only way to get rid of it was to download a program off the internet, something loader.exe, but i hit the key before i could write it down, does any one know how to remove it? like a program that can detect boot programs or something like that? i have no clue were to start...

item.title: Windows boot program
item.dc:creator: @Hiaburi Hiaburi
item.description:
@Hiaburi wrote:

done that, i reinstalled windows and its still there, so i dont even think it is on my hard drive…

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Hiaburi Hiaburi
item.description:
@Hiaburi wrote:

linux is not on mine, i sued that as an example…stupid one i guess, yea its not anything to worry about, but since its there it may be using my already scarce HD space…

Read full topic

item.title: Windows boot program
item.dc:creator: @Mr.Chris Mr.Chris
item.description:
@Mr.Chris wrote:

Hiaburi:

eh…not the blue screen of death, just a blue boot menu, it lists all partitions of the hd and all drives, like on mine it sais my cd drive name, then hd then usb info, and if i had multiple os’s i could use that screen to select which one to boot to, but i dont like the fact that the program is on my pc because i didn’t put it there, and now its hidden so i have no idea how to remove it

It will most likely be something to do with Linux or GRUB. I shouldn’t think it is anything to worry about (did you install Linux on an external HD or did you partition your internal?). As long as you can choose to boot from your internal HD.

Read full topic
